discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
An event runs automatically each night to send reminders to contract administrators about contract expiration dates so they can renew or renegotiate the contract. This email is sent at the following times:
90 days ahead of the contract expiration date
60 days ahead of the contract expiration date
30 days ahead of the contract expiration date
On the contract expiration date

https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/utah-it-asset-management/page/product/contract-management/task/t_SendAContractNotification.html

Selected Answer: C
Page 433 of Vancouver text

Selected Answer: C
One of the most important aspects of contract management is to be aware when the contracts are due to expire so you can determine whether to renew, adjust (e.g., extend), or let the contract expire.

Selected Answer: C
Expire date
C is correct p 319 Tokyo Book "One of the most important aspects of contract management is to be aware when the contracts are due to expire so you can detemrine whether to renew, adjust"

Selected Answer: C
Expired Date is the most important.

questions.question_text: Inventory audit results provide easy visibility into the reconciliation of scanned assets to the existing inventory. What audit statuses are displayed as part of the results? (Choose four.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Answer is Stock Rules

Selected Answer: D
Stock rules is correct, and it`s informs the manager with what needs to be ordered.

Selected Answer: D
Answer: D. Stock Rules

Explanation: "Stock rules are defined criteria stating that when the inventory of a particular asset in a particular stockroom reaches a specified threshold, a certain number should either be transferred from another stockroom or ordered from a vendor."

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-it-asset-management/page/product/asset-management/concept/c_StockRules.html

Selected Answer: D
Stock Rules

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
There are only 2 baseline asset states listed here, In stock and Retired

Selected Answer: ABC
These are all baseline states - although the 'consumed' one doesn't show up for normal hardware assets

Selected Answer: ABC
The baseline states are:

On Order
In Stock
In Transit
In Use
Consumed
In Maintenance
Retired
Missing
Has anyone recently passed this exam using these questions?
We need to choose 3. AC is partially correct since that is only 2. So ABC is the right answer.
ABC is correct

ABC is the correct answer -
Asset states :- on order, in stock, in transit, in use, consumed, in maintenance, retired, missing
ABC...although Consumed does not display for non-consumable assets. See the UI Policy "Show consumed status for consumables and in use for non consumables""
it's ABC p71 in book
